bill_title: to clarify taxing authority for political subdivisions.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to clarify taxing authority for political subdivisions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. No county, city, or other governmental unit, including governmental units chartered under S.D. Const., Art. IX, § 2, unless otherwise specifically provided by statute, may, after March 1, 1996, enact or increase any tax, fee, or other charge of any kind if a similar tax, fee, or charge is currently levied, assessed, imposed, or collected by the State, its boards, commissions, authorities, agencies, or other entities. Section 2. That § 9-12-19 be amended to read as follows: 9-12-18. The governing body of a municipality governed by a home rule charter , including municipalities chartered under S.D. Const., Art. IX, § 2, may not impose any permit or inspection fee, beyond the actual cost of the inspection, on any property which is owned by a unit of government unless a higher fee is established through a joint powers agreement entered into pursuant to chapter 1-24. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to clarify taxing authority for political subdivisions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. No county, city, or other governmental unit, including governmental units chartered under S.D. Const., Art. IX, § 2, unless otherwise specifically provided by statute, may, enact or increase, in any form a tax, fee, or charge that is: related to the state lottery; similar to a tax which provides revenues to the state; or similar to state licensing or regulatory fees enacted by statute or adopted by rule. The provisions of this section do not prohibit any tax or fee enacted and imposed on or before March 1, 1996. Section 2. That § 9-12-19 be amended to read as follows: 9-12-18. The governing body of a municipality governed by a home rule charter , including municipalities chartered under S.D. Const., Art. IX, § 2, may not impose any permit or inspection fee, beyond the actual cost of the inspection, on any property which is owned by a unit of government unless a higher fee is established through a joint powers agreement entered into pursuant to chapter 1-24 agreed to by the affected governmental unit . Section 3. That § 6-12-13 be repealed. 6-12-13. No county or city or combination thereof adopting a home rule charter may enact or increase any tax or fee that is not allowed to be enacted or increased by any county, city, or combination thereof that has not adopted a home rule charter. The provisions of this section do not prohibit any tax or fee enacted and imposed on or before March 1, 1996. Section 4. That chapter 6-12 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Nothing in section 1 of this Act is intended to authorize any county, city, or other governmental unit chartered under S.D. Const., Art. IX § 2, to enact or increase a tax, fee, or other charge that is denied by its charter, the Constitution, or the general laws of the state.
